entry.title: Earnest Andersson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite little formal education, Earnest Andersson (pictured) was a successful inventor, businessman, amateur athlete, race car driver, pilot, photographer, radio operator, pro golfer, and composer?

entry.title: city council of Bogor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 32 former members of the city council of Bogor, Indonesia, were convicted of corruption in 2010, including 3 who were still serving?

entry.title: Lincoln Fitzgerald (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lincoln Fitzgerald survived a 1949 murder attempt and went on to run three Nevada casinos?

entry.title: digging a trench (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that by digging a trench through Hisarlik, Heinrich Schliemann destroyed parts of the ruins of Troy?

entry.title: International Fire Marshals Association (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the International Fire Marshals Association is partly responsible for the ban on fireworks in some U.S. states?

entry.title: Trần Lập (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Trần Lập was involved in Vietnam's first internet copyright lawsuit?

entry.title: Bitter Legacy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1982 book Bitter Legacy by historian Richard C. Lukas describes how in the early Cold War years America lost influence over Poland, which became a part of the Soviet empire?

entry.title: Andrea Carla Michaels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Andrea Carla Michaels, who has written more than 80 crosswords for The New York Times, is known as the "Pizza Lady" in San Francisco?
